noun.description: An instance of pretending to be someone else in order to deceive others.
examples: I discovered the imposture as soon as her doppelgänger arrived
in a day and a night of violence and imposture William Bentley also succeeds in capturing a smuggler

origin: Mid 16th century: via French from late Latin impostura, from Latin imposit- imposed upon, from the verb imponere (see impose).
